meanings.definition: To tilt or turn up at an angle.
meanings.sent1: She cockbilled her head to get a better view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic cockbilled the car to inspect the underside.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat cockbilled its ears when it heard a strange noise.
meanings.sent4: The sun cockbilled over the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches cockbilled towards the sky, reaching for the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: He cockbilled the heavy box onto his shoulder and carried it inside.
meanings.sent2: The crane cockbilled the container effortlessly onto the ship.
meanings.sent3: The magician cockbilled the rabbit out of the hat to the audience's amazement.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits cockbilled when she received the unexpected good news.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon cockbilled gracefully into the sky, carrying its passengers.

meanings.sent1: She cockbilled the picture frame on the wall for a more artistic display.
meanings.sent2: The farmer cockbilled the scarecrow in the field to ward off birds.
meanings.sent3: The chef cockbilled the dessert plate with a fancy garnish.
meanings.sent4: The detective cockbilled the evidence board to connect the clues.
meanings.sent5: The architect cockbilled the roof of the house for better rainwater drainage.
